Every day she sells door to door throughout the city. In this way she manages to sell or charge something every day, since she also allows credit with a weekly payment. She has been doing this work for seven months. Since her separation she has recognized a need to look for a source of income to provide for her children.

She will use this loan to purchase more clothing and jewelry. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because with one of the loans she started her business. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Dolores Evelin

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Grupo De Crédito Santa Lucia De Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5 años que estudia en jardín de infantes. El marido trabaja en una constructora. 
Doña Dolores es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De crédito  y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank group "Santa Lucia de Quiroga" meets every 15 days in the parish of Quiroga, in the city of Calceta, a place where most people work in farming, livestock and crops, and who sell their product.
This is where Dolores, 22, lives. She and her common-law husband have a five-year-old child in kindergarten. Her husband works at a construction company.
Dolores is a housewife and in order to make an income and help her husband with the household expenses, she sells clothing by catalog and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works three days a week for two or three hours. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days. She's been working at this business for two years and it's going very well. Perfume and cosmetics are the products she sells most as they're very good. 
She's requesting this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She's been part of the Communal Bank since its beginning and she's happy the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 24-year-old from Nablus who lives in Askar camp, a Palestinian refugee camp. It is located on the outskirts of the West Bank city of Nablus and was established in 1950 on 209 dunams [one dunam is 1000 square meters] of land. In 1960 the camp was expanded onto a further 90 dunams.

Sameer thought of doing something to contribute to the family income, as his parents' income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of all the family members. His life condition forced him to complete his secondary education. In 2005 he started sewing at a shop as an employee. After that he opened his own workshop after one year. He sews clothes for the clothing shops in his area on demand.

His dream is to make his own brand and sell in large areas. Sameer is asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy another sewing machine and shelves. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and shelves for his workshop

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is 29 years old and a married man, living in Sana`a, Yemen.  He is a hardworking man and tries his best to provide for his family’s expenses. He has a bus with which he has earned his daily income for many years. 

He benefited from a first loan which was funded by Kiva. He intends to use the profit that he has saved to buy a bus for transportation but that amount is not enough to buy another small bus. 

So he requested a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy another bus which will be used to increase his profit. This improvement will enable him to increase his capital. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for funding the first loan.

loans.use: to buy another small bus which will be used to increase his profit.

loans.name: Adoyia's Group

texts.en:
Adoyia is a 44 year old woman from Iraq. She is married and the mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Adoyia is one of the many Iraqi women who work from home using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 10 years experience with her small, home-based sewing business, and as an experienced seamstress she is constantly looking for opportunities to improve the services she can provide to her customers and generate more income. Her work is interrupted frequently by power cuts in her area. To overcome this challenge and be able to manage her work and time better, she would like to buy a small generator and also a new sewing machine. To be able to afford these purchases she is participating in a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq (RI-Iraq). 

RI-Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue supporting Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work with a new sewing machine and a small generator.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 30 years old and married.  She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is living with her children at her brother’s home.  

To afford her expenses, she conducts a small bookstore at home; she sells stationery in her locality. 

To cope with demand, she wants to buy more stationery items. She wants to buy more copybooks, lead pencils, drawing pencils, canvas, books, etc.

Therefore she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can buy more stationery for students.

She teaches her own children by herself; she derives sufficient income from this practice at the end of the month.

She is very glad after taking this loan and praises the lenders who are taking an active part in fund raising with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy stationery to sell at home by herself.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman involved in the work of stitching clothes for many years. When Nasreen was not earning, her family was going through a big financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family, so Nasreen felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working at home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders, so contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more spools of thread, along with the packets of lace, zippers and buttons in various colours. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, along with packets of lace, zippers, and buttons in various colours.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra, age 32, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a cosmetics shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for the family. Sidra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. 

He will use the loan amount to purchase a variety of cosmetics, including lipsticks, makeup kits, body lotions, etc., to sell. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Sidra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics including lipsticks, makeup kits, body lotions, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 60-year-old, married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her locality. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Nazeeran has gradually improved her business with the support of BRAC Pakistan. She applied a new loan to buy an additional buffalo for getting more milk to sell. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and showing excellent payment behaviour till yet. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business. 
Nazeeran gives thanks to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr: Kokoé est une dame de 51ans. Mariée à un transitaire, ils ont 03 enfants en charge. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle a démarré en 2000 la vente de pagnes, de bazins et des produits divers à la devanture de sa maison. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille. Afin d’atteindre ses objectifs, elle fait sa toute première demande à WAGES pour revendre et tiré profit de la vente.
texts.en: Kokoé is a 51-year old woman, who is married to a freight broker, and they have three children in their care. In order to give a helping hand to her husband with the household expenses, she started selling "pagnes" (pieces of brightly-colored cloth), damask fabric and other products in front of her house. She would like to expand her activity and ensure that her family flourishes. In order to achieve her objectives, she is requesting a first loan from WAGES to be able to resell and make a profit from her sales.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes", damask fabric and others.

loans.name: Ugiltozhy

texts.ru: Угилтожи добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее старшая дочь совершеннолетняя, а двое ее сыновей еще несовершеннолетние. Они учатся в средней школе. Ее муж сварщик. Угилтожи более 12 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Угилтожи имеет большой опыт и поэтому она с легкостью справляется со своей работой. Угилтожи очень добрая женщина. Она всегда поддерживает своего мужа. Ее муж нуждается в автомашине для своего бизнеса. Однако он не имеет денег. Он должен улучшить качество услуги и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Угилтожи хочет помочь своему мужу. Она тоже не имеет достаточно денег для покупки автомашины. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ugiltozhy is an honest, hardworking woman who is married and currently raising 3 children.  Her oldest daughter is already an adult by age, whereas her two sons are still studying in grade school.  Her husband works as a welder, while Ugiltozhy works a seamstress.  She works out of her own home, and has a lot of experience; she has been at it for more than 12 years, and manages her workload with ease.  

Ugiltozhy is a kind woman, and always helps her husband as best she can.  Her husband is in need of a vehicle for his business, but she and her husband lack the money to buy one.  He wants to be able to increase the quality of his services as a welder and attract more clients.  Ugiltozhy wants to help her  husband; as such, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy a car for his business, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy a car for her husband’s business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is Daniel. He previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain their tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in his family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain their tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Daniel dreams of having another tricycle unit and hopes that his family will always be in good health. He meets up every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Tavousse Group

texts.fr:
Mr  R.ANDRE  est responsable du groupe TAVOUSSE. Marié, il est père de 08enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 04 vont à l’école. Il a 10personnes en charge.
Mr est cultivateur et fait l’élevage depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier. Ses clients sont  les bouchés du marché.
Il veut s’acheter 03chèvres et  02moutons.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne bien construire sa cour.
texts.en:
Mr. R. Andre is the representative of the Tavousse group. He is married and has eight children between the ages of 12 and 25. Four of his children go to school. He has 10 dependents. 

He is a farmer and has worked in livestock farming for 10 years. He buys his supplies in his neighborhood. His clients are butchers from the market. 

He would like to buy three goats and two sheep. He would like to reinvest his profits in his business and construct a stable yard.

loans.use: buy three goats and two sheep.

loans.name: Santos Narciso

texts.es:
Santos de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado. Desde corta edad se dedico a ayudarle a su padre a trabajar en los cultivos, hace varios años decidió emigrar a Estados Unidos, pero fue deportado de nuevo a El Salvador. Entonces, decidió  cultivar la tierra para ganarse el sustento diario de su familia. Esta acompañado, su pareja de vida se dedica a las labores domesticas y trabaja también en la crianza de pollos y cerdos.

Tres hijos de los cuatro, están estudiando y la mayor emigro hacia los Estados Unidos, ella les apoya cuando puede con  pequeños ingresos. Ademas de sus hijos, vive con ellos su cuñado, este tuvo un accidente y le tienen que ayudar para que tenga su sustento.

Santos se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, ademas, trabaja  en la crianza de cerdos y pollo de engorde, estas ultimas actividades las realiza desde hace 3 años, teniendo otras fuentes de ingresos aparte de los cultivos que maneja. La milpa la tiene cerca de su casa al igual que su pequeña granja,  a estas actividades le ayudan su mujer y sus hijos cuando tienen tiempo libre.

El préstamo lo necesita, para aumentar la producción de cerdos y pollo de engorde, quiere comprar 200 pollos y 2 cerdos para engordarlos. Esto lo hace porque se acerca la época navideña y es una buena oportunidad para vender estos animales y productos, con mejores precios. Ademas,  se garantiza la venta de toda la producción.

Así aprovechara la oportunidad que se le presenta y obtendrá su familia ingresos que le servirán para cubrir con sus necesidades y tener recursos para seguir invirtiendo en el próximo año.

Su sueño, es establecer una granja donde se pueda incorporar a las actividades productivas, que les generen los recursos suficientes para sostener el negocio y cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Hacer un negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old and studied until the fourth grade. From a young age, he helped his father to work in the fields. Several years ago, he decided to immigrate to the United States, but he was deported again to El Salvador. Then, he decided to farm the land in order to earn a daily living for his family. He is in a relationship, and his life partner does housework and also works raising chickens and pigs.

Three of his four children are in school, and the oldest immigrated to the United States. She helps them when she can with small income. In addition to his children, his brother-in-law lives with them; he had an accident, and they have to help him out so that he has a means of support.

Santos works in agriculture; additionally, he raises pigs and chickens for fattening. He started doing the latter 3 years ago to have another source of income apart from the crops that he manages. He has his cornfield near his house, as is his little farm. His partner and children help him with this work when they have free time.

He needs the loan to increase his production of pigs and chickens for fattening. He wants to buy 200 chickens and 2 pigs to fatten them. He is doing this because the Christmas season is coming up, and it's a good opportunity to sell these animals and products at better prices. In addition, he is guaranteed to sell everything that he produces.

In this way, he will take advantage of the opportunity presented to him, and his family will obtain earnings that will enable them to cover their expenses and to have resources in order to continue investing for the next year.

His dream is to establish a farm where he can incorporate his productive work that will generate sufficient resources to support his business and cover his basic needs, and to make it a family farm.

loans.use: to purchase 200 chickens and 2 pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is from Gyumri town, where he lives with his wife. He is a sports trainer with 10 years of experience working in that field. He has a lot of students since he is very attentive and carefully teaches all the details about the sport. So now this hardworking and skilled trainer asks for a loan for being able to purchase sport clothing and pay for the equipment of the gym where he provides his training. 

Samvel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Samvel to be able to purchase needed supplies and provide better conditions for his students.

loans.use: to pay for sport clothing and equipment for the gym

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is 36 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city which is in Lori region. Ani works at the school as a teacher and she teaches girls how to do needlework, how to knit and how to sew. At the same time, she is studying at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute at the distance learning department.  In order to be employed, she needs to have a higher education so she combines her work and learning.  Ani also has several pupils at her home to whom she gives paid lessons of needlework.  Ani is married and she has two children. 

Ani asks for a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams  since she wants to buy a computer which will help her to be informed about the latest innovations connected with her work.

loans.use: to buy a computer which will help her to be informed about innovations connected with her work

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 55 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have both 5 children. She sells mattresses and umbrellas. She has spent four years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more mattresses for sale. She dreams to become a distributor in the future. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase bags to sell in her community.

loans.name: Kenja

texts.ru: Кенча добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 48 лет. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Сыновья Кенчи работают в России строителями и зарабатывают хороший доход. Каждый месяц они высылают некоторые денежные средства своим родителям. Кенча живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он также занимается своим бизнесом. Кенча занимается дехканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Кенча занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Кенча хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Кенча заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Kenja is a good-natured and cheerful man, 48 years old. He is married and has four children. Kenja's sons are working in Russia doing construction and earning a good income. Every month they send some money to their parents. Kenja lives with his wife in a small house in a rural village. In order to feed his family, he also runs his own business. Kenja works on a collective farm and keeps livestock. He has some land. Some of his land is irrigated, but not all. Here, Kenja grows carrots, potatoes and grains. His wife helps him take care of and raise cattle. Since their plot of land is large, they also graze their cattle on it. The livestock business brings in a good income, so Kenja wants to expand the business by increasing his cattle herd. For this he turned to the Arvand to get a loan to buy cattle. Kenja thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Trust's Group

texts.en:
These members are part of a group called Trust, which is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Gershon, who is 40 years old. He is married to a woman named Elizabeth. They have one child who attends school.

Gershon lives with his wife and together they provide for the household expenses. It is for this reason that Gershon has been selling engine oils for 20 years. He needs a loan to buy more engine oils in Ghana.

In order to expand his business, Gershon has partnered with the other members to request a fourth loan from ID-Ghana. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. They need a total of 2,700 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more engine oil and sell to customers

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en: These are ladies who are part of the group Noyaa, which is composed of three individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Patience, is 49 years old. Patience never attended school but has eight years of work experience in selling new wax prints (clothing). She is single and has three dependent children, all in school. In order to provide for her children, Patience (standing right in the photo) has been selling new wax prints. Patience buys wax prints from the market in Ghana. With the goal of bolstering her business, Patience, together with the other members of this group who are also selling fish and batik fabric, is seeking their seventh loan of GHS 3,100 from ID-Ghana and her second loan from Kiva. Their prior loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: To buy wax prints to resell

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar is a 32-year-old married man. He and his wife have been married for ten years. His family lives in the Xirdalan settlement of the Abseron region. For 20 years now, Etibar’s family have been Internally Displaced Peoples from their native land. Etibar’s wife is a tailor. He has two sons: the older son, Aydin, is in the third grade, while his other son, Mahmud, is preparing for school.

To earn a living, Etibar is a taxi driver. Specifically, he transports passengers between Baku and Abseron.

Now he is seeking to expand his business. As a result, he is applying for a loan in the amount of 600 AZN to pay for repairs on his car. In the future, he would like to paint his car. Etibar is thankful to Komak and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to expand his business by repairing his car

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Judas Tadeo está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante ya que han empezado de cero, conociéndose y aprendiendo a trabajar juntas.
Todas ellas se dedican a hacer artesanías en Karanday, la cual es una planta que se teje y del cual se hace abanicos, sombreros y demás. Edith, la presidenta, pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de Karanday y así seguir trabajando.
Todas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que recibe, que les permitirá crecer como microempresarias.
texts.en:
The "San Judas Tadeo" group is in its 1st cycle of the Women's Entrepreneurship Program, where they all work and help each other get ahead after starting from zero, getting to know one another and learning to work together. 
They all make crafts from the leaves of the Caranday palm (Copernicia alba). The leaves are woven to make fans, hats and other. Edith, the president, is requesting this loan in order to invest it in Caranday palm leaves, so they can continue their work.
They are all very grateful for this opportunity, which will help them grow as microbusiness owners.

loans.use: buy Caranday palm leaves to make crafts.

loans.name: Barrio Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Barrio Fátima está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo dentro del grupo. Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo.
La Sra. Juana es la presidenta del comité y pide este crédito para la Compra de telas e insumos para la confección de prendas de vestir, ya que ella es modista y quiere poder seguir innovando y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Barrio Fatima is in its second cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other in order to get ahead through their effort and constant work within the group. They all actively participate in the activities the group organizes and help each other meet the group's common goals.

Juana is the President of the committee and is requesting this loan to purchase fabric and sewing supplies to make clothing items, since she is a dressmaker and wants to be able to continue innovating and satisfying her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Nickson, an up-and-coming farmer living in Kitale, the North Rift area of Kenya. He is married and has two children. 

He has been farming to earn his livelihood, producing and selling milk, eggs, tea, and maize. Besides farming, he has a transport business using a motorbike as an extra source of income. He loves dairy farming because when dairy cows are well taken care of they produce more, whereas his challenges are diseases and shortage of pasture during dry seasons.

Nickson chose Juhudi Kilimo because he believes they will help him improve his and his family's living standards. During the training received he learned how to develop a lifestyle of saving. This loan will boost his income source and enable him to cater to his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ángela Del Rosario

texts.es: Ángela es madre soltera de dos hijos, a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola, ha trabajado como empleada en diferentes tiendas escolares y cafeterías de colegios de la zona, elaborando los alimentos fritos que allí vendían, actualmente trabaja con un hermano como vendedora en un almacén de electrodomésticos y los fines de semana alterna su empleo, con la venta de alimentos fritos y comidas rápidas, negocio ubicado en su casa, allí trabaja viernes, sábados y domingos de 5:00 a 10:00 pm y, de esta forma complementa los ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Su pujanza, dedicación y perseverancia la impulsan a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar utensilios de cocina (cucharones, ollas, aceiteras, entre otros) e insumos al por mayor (verduras, carne, pollo, aceite, carnes frías, salsas, entre otros), de esta manera podrá cambiar los utensilios que ya están en mal estado y preparará los alimentos teniendo en cuenta la higiene y la imagen adecuada, para que los comensales sientan más gusto al consumir sus productos y así pueda atraer nuevos clientes, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Ángela sueña con montar su negocio en un lugar más estratégico, donde haya más afluencia de personas, que le permita lograr una estabilidad económica favorable para seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar y poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela is the single mother of two children, who she has provided for on her own. She has worked as an employee in various school stores and school cafeterias in the area, preparing the fried foods that they sell there. At present she works with a brother as a seller in an electrical appliance store and also works weekends selling fried food and fast food, a business she runs out of her house. Here, she works Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 5:00 to 10:00 PM. In this way she is able to supplement her income to meet her household's needs.

Her strength, dedication and perseverance motivated her to request the support of a loan to purchase kitchen utensils (ladles, pots, cruets and other items), and wholesale supplies (vegetables, meat, chicken, oil, cold cuts, salsas and other items). With these she will be able to swap out the utensils that are in poor condition and prepare the food with proper hygiene and image in mind so guests feel more comfortable consuming her products. This way she may attract new customers, which would increase her sales and the income she receives for her work.

Ángela dreams of setting up her business in a more strategic location with more people. This would allow her to achieve economic stability, continue to provide for her home and to be able to enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her children.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils (ladles, pots, cruets and other items) and wholesale supplies (vegetables, meat, chicken, oil, cold cuts, salsas and other items).

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana de 29 años de edad,  es una joven muy entusiasta y con deseos de superación, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, desde que se acompañó. Actualmente, vive en la casa de sus suegros junto con su hijo. 
Ana se dedica a los oficios domésticos en la casa de sus suegros, como: cocinar, lavar, planchar y además visita a su mamá cada semana, para llevarle algunas cositas de comer y le hace compañía.
Con el préstamo, Ana estará financiando 2 graduaciones en la misma familia, ya que necesitan el dinero para comprar ropa y zapatos de ambos, también necesita para comprar los alimentos, para los invitados a la fiesta de graduación. 

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados de bachiller y con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old. She is a very enthusiastic young woman and driven to improve herself. She has been a homemaker ever since she moved in with her partner. She currently lives in her parents-in-law's house along with their son. Ana works doing household chores in her parents-in-law's home, such as cooking, washing, and ironing, and she also visits her mother every week to bring her a little something to eat and keep her company. 

Ana will use this loan to finance two family graduations, because they need the money to buy clothing and shoes for both. She also needs to buy food for the graduation guests.

Her dream is to see her children graduate from high school and attend university.

loans.use: to finance two family graaduations.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a kind man who is 49 years old. He is a married, father of a soldier and a daughter.  This is why he pours his whole soul into his work. He is involved in his own business to support his family. He is involved in farming and animal husbandry. And his wife helps him to take care of and raise livestock. The animal husbandry business yields a good income, and this is why Khalil wants to expand this business by increasing his animals' headcount. He came to Kiva for this purpose to obtain a loan and buy lambs. He thanks all in advance for the support.

loans.use: To buy lambs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, salt, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Harut

texts.en:
Harut is a young driver from the town of Goris. He is married with a child and has worked as a taxi driver for three years already. Despite his young age, Harut perfectly manages to cover his family's needs with the income he gathers from driving a taxi.

Currently, because of his family's difficult financial position, Harut wasn't able to save money for renovation of the car. He now asks for a loan to be able to purchase tires for winter and partially renovate the car, since on some parts of his car the metal is seriously damaged. 

Harut has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for Harut and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new tires for winter and partially renovate his taxi

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva tiene 59 años, está casada con el Sr. Blas hace varios años, con quien tiene 3 hijos y comenta que también tiene 4 nietos. 
La Sra. Elva es comerciante, se dedica a la producción y venta de productos de limpieza (detergentes, enjuagues de ropas, desinfectante entre otros), además vende miel de su propio cañaveral, comenta que el crédito que pide es para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para la producción de sus elementos de limpieza, como ser envases, químicos y demás.
Está muy agradecida con fundación y Kiva por la oportunidad de otorgarle un préstamo y poder aumentar su negocio y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elva is 59 years old and has been married to Blas for several years. She has three children with him and says she also has four grandchildren. Elva is a retailer and works making and selling cleaning products (detergents, rinses for clothing, disinfectants, and other items). She also sells molasses from her own sugar cane plantation. 

She says she will invest the loan she is requesting in purchasing materials to make her cleaning products like containers, chemicals, and others. She is very grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity of getting a loan and being able to increase her business in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy containers and chemicals to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 28-year-old lady and a mother of one child aged six. She runs a general store in Narok town, Kenya. 

Lydia has operated this business for the last 5 years with a monthly income of about 12,000 KES. She learnt about Kadet from her parents who are long serving members of Kadet Ltd. She has been advanced her first loan of 50,000 KES, which will help her to purchase consumable goods for the business.

She will use the proceeds to repay the loan as well as take care of her family's basic needs. She hopes to grow the business to a bigger and profitable outlet.

loans.use: to buy additional consumables for her kiosk.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analyn hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her general store business.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 50 years old and blessed with three children, aged 25, 23, and 15 years old, respectively. He manages rental houses, and has been doing this for six years. Right now, his monthly income is 1,000,000 KSH. He will use his loan to build more rental houses and use his anticipated profit to open another business.This is his third loan, and he successfully paid back his previous loan. His hopes and dreams are to live a better life.

loans.use: to build more rental houses.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es: Adriana, a sus 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola, trabajando arduas jornadas para conseguir el sustento diario. Hace aproximadamente 6 meses adquirió su propio negocio, un almacén de variedades en el que trabaja de lunes a domingo de 9:00 am a 9:00 pm, nunca ha recibido capacitación, todo lo que hoy en día sabe lo ha aprendido por el método de prueba/error o por recomendaciones de sus familiares y amigos. Su empuje, perseverancia y las ganas de salir adelante, le han permitido lograr los objetivos que se propone y superar los desafíos que se le van presentando por ser madre cabeza de hogar, sin embargo, esto la motiva aún más para seguir luchando por los que ama. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (artículos de papelería, juguetería, productos de aseo personal, chocolatería, dulces y mecato, bolsas de regalo, tarjetas de obsequios, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta con la llegada de la temporada navideña, en la que sus ventas incrementan, logrando así un mejoramiento en la economía del hogar. De esta forma, Adriana desea seguir luchando para alcanzar sus metas y hacer de su negocio una buena fuente de ingresos, que sea rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Adriana, 42, is a single mother who has raised her three children by herself, working long and hard days to earn enough to get by.  About six months ago, she started her own business; a variety store which she works in every day from 9 o’clock in the morning until 9 o’clock at night.  She has never received any training.  She has learnt all she knows through experience and from advice given to her by her family and friends.  Her determination, perseverance and desire to be successful have enabled her to achieve her goals and overcome the challenges that being a mother and head of a household involve.  In fact, this gives her even more motivation to work hard for the sake of those she loves.  

Now she is asking for a loan to invest in some wholesale items (stationery, toys, personal care products, chocolate, candy and snacks, gift bags and gift cards, among other things), which provide her with enough stock to satisfy customer demand over the busy Christmas period which is drawing nearer.  During this season her sales increase and she can earn more to support her family.  

Adriana wants to continue striving to achieve her goals and make her business a good source of income to provide her children with a better standard of living and education.

loans.use: to buy wholesale items such as stationery, toys, personal care products, chocolate, candy and snacks, gift bags, gift cards and other things.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia es un grupo que hace 17 ciclos viene trabajando junto, es un grupo de mujeres muy unido, que gracias a que todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo están creciendo mucho.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fanni, quien tiene una mercería donde ofrece de todo a sus clientes, y cuenta que gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido, pudo mejorar el manejo de su negocio, y le está yendo mejor. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo, y así seguir ayudando a su familia, pues ella es el sostén de su hogar.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos varios para su mercería, como ser prendas, calzados, lencerías, artículos para el hogar, etc. lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia group has been working together for 17 loan cycles.  The women are very united and, thanks to all the work they do, are growing significantly.

One of the members is Fanni who has a notions store where she offers a bit of everything to her customers.  Thanks to the training she received she was able to manage her business better and it is doing well.  Her goal is to continue expanding and supporting her family, since she is the head of household.

Fanni is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products for her store such as clothing, shoes, lingerie, home products, etc. which will help her stabilize her business plan and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, lingerie, home products, etc.

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
El  Sr.  Albino es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 28 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. María de 26 años con quien tiene un hijo, el cual es el motivo de lucha de ambos, y por quien están esforzándose para darle lo mejor.
Albino se dedica a prestar servicios como taxi de pasajeros en un cruce, comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que es una persona muy amable y cordial.
Pide este préstamo para comprar productos varios para la venta, como comestibles y bebidas,  y así tener mejor ingreso extra que le ayudará a luchar más por su familia.
texts.en:
Albino is from the city of Santaní.  He is 28, married to María, 26, and they have a son who is the reason they work as hard as they can to give him the best.

Albino has a a passenger taxi service on a corner and he claims he has many good customers as he is a kind, cordial person.

He is requesting a loan to buy several things to sell such as food and beverages to earn extra income for the family.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is 23 years old. He is a business man, and he has been doing business for 1 1/2 years. Right now his monthly income is 12,000 KSH. He will use his anticipated profit to repay the loan. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to add stock to his business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, John has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells various retail items. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items for sale and will help John to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living of his family. John hopes that in the future he will be able to expand more on the business. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items to sell

loans.name: Bartolomé

texts.es: Bartolomé es un mecánico automotriz que, desde que era pequeño conoció la labor gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, quien tenía un taller de reparación de vehículos; gracias a ello, desde hace aproximadamente 7 años tiene su propio taller en un sector muy reconocido y transitado de la ciudad, trabaja todos los días y de esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar herramientas de trabajo y repuestos al por mayor (llaves, destornilladores, tuercas, neumáticos, bujías, luces, espejos retrovisores, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y podrá realizar su labor de manera más ágil, además podrá ofrecer tendrá los repuestos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, logrando así mejorar los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Bartolomé manifiesta que desea seguir trabajando para lograr hacer de su taller, un negocio consolidado y rentable, que le genere una estabilidad económica favorable para poder disfrutar con su familia de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bartolome is an auto-repair mechanic, who learned the trade as a child from his father, who had a vehicle repair shop. Thanks to that, he has had his own shop for about seven years, located in a very well known and busy area of the city. He works every day in order to generate enough income to provide for his family.

He is currently requesting the help of this loan to buy tools for work and wholesale spare parts (wrenches, screwdrivers, nuts, tires, spark plugs, lights, rearview mirrors, and other items). This will allow him to improve his working conditions and to do business more efficiently. He will also be able to offer the spare parts his customers need and improve the income he earns from his work.

Bartolome says he wants to keep working in order to make his shop a well-established and profitable business that will generate financial stability and allow him to enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy tools and wholesale spare parts.

loans.name: Héctor Fredy

texts.es: Héctor, a sus 47 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio taller de reparación de bicicletas, actividad que surgió de la necesidad de emplearse, tras perder el empleo en la empresa donde laboró por muchos años y que, por recorte de personal, se vio obligado a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitieran continuar generando recursos para llevar el sustento a su pequeño hijo de 3 años. Con los conocimientos y la experiencia que obtuvo en su antiguo empleo, se decidió a montar su propio taller de reparación, ubicado en su casa, y en el que ha recibido muy buenos resultados porque ya es reconocido en el sector. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar repuestos al por mayor (frenos, cadenas, tuercas, parches, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de inventario para poder realizar su labor de manera adecuada y entregar a tiempo el trabajo, así se dará a conocer aún más y podrá atraer nuevos clientes.  Héctor sueña con tener un almacén de repuestos para bicicletas y motos, que sea rentable y que le permita lograr una estabilidad económica para dar a su hijo una excelente educación y mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Hector, 47, has his own bicycle repair shop, which he started to provide employment for himself.  After many years in his previous job, he was made redundant as staff were laid off, so he had to look for other ways of earning a living to provide for his little three-year-old son.
With the knowledge and experience gained at his old job, he decided to set up a repair workshop in his own house.  He has been successful and become well-known in the sector.  

He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts in bulk (brakes, chains, nuts and patches among other things), that will allow him to have a better range of stock so he can work better and finish repairs on time.  This will help build his reputation and attract new customers. 
 
Hector dreams of having his own workshop with spares for both bikes and motorbikes that will be profitable and give him the financial stability to provide his son with an excellent education and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in bulk (brakes, chains, nuts, patches and other things)

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña María Concepción tiene 39 años de edad ella es casada y es madre de familia de un solo hijo el cual tiene un año de edad, en su compañía vive un hijastro el cual se involucra en los diferentes trabajos a realizar en el campo junto a su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleta la cual no pudo terminar por la falta de recursos económicos en su familia ya que es de escasos recursos. Gracias al esfuerzo que sus padres hicieron en su juventud mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde hace 17 años pudo donarle un pedazo de tierra el cual ha traído muchas bendiciones y mucha dicha en su familia ya que por medio del cultivo de café generan los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos que se presentan como la medicina con muchas restricciones, vestimenta y alimentación. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 3 kilómetros al cual se trasladan caminando y en ocasiones en bestia. Como desafío que ella presenta es el alza de los precios en el mercado sobre los insumos ya que incluido a esto el acarreo del producto representa un gasto el cual ella y su esposo no pueden cubrir para poder asistir sus cultivos de café ya que consideran que la competencia no es un problema pues el mercado está definido. 
Por lo que hoy día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como foliares, abonos de diferentes tipos e insecticidas con los cuales dará mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. 
Sus sueños son apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios verlos graduados a nivel universitario y darles una mejor calidad y estilo de vida.
texts.en: María Concepción is 39 years old, married, and the mother of a one-year-old son. She also lives with her stepson, who works in the fields alongside her husband. She was never able to finish primary school because her family, which was of limited means, lacked the economic resources. Because her parents worked hard during her childhood and taught her how to work the land, 17 years ago they were able to give her a piece of land which has brought many blessings and a lot of happiness to her family.  By growing coffee they earn money they need to cover expenses they are faced with such as medicine (to some degree), clothing, and food.  Maria Concepción's coffee fields are three kilometers away, and are reached by walking or occasionally on an animal. A challenge she faces is the rising cost of inputs, which make the cost of transporting the product too high for her and her husband since they need to attend to their coffee crop.  They don’t consider the competition a problem since the market is fixed.  For these reasons, today María Concepción has asked for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers of various kinds and insecticides which will allow her to maintain her coffee crop.  She dreams of supporting her children through school, seeing them graduate from college, and providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a 24-year-old farmer living in the Kitale area of the North Rift area of Kenya. This is an area widely known for its vast maize production. She is married and has four children. Farming is her main source of income. She has done it for ten years, and she produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, maize, and other vegetables. Out of all her farming activities, she loves dairy farming the most since it has high returns. Her greatest challenges are pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock.

Phanice chose Juhudi Kilimo for financing to help her improve on her farming activities. She says this loan will help her provide milk for her family and also provide for her children's school fees. This will improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana Gisela

texts.es: Ana ha trabajado durante 12 años como comerciante, por lo que cuenta con amplia experiencia y conocimientos en esta labor; hace algunos años una vecina le enseñó  todo lo relacionado con la venta de mercancía por catálogos, por lo que comenzó también con esta labor para complementar los ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo en la carga económica del hogar. Ella ofrece los productos a los compañeros de su empleo actual, a vecinos, familiares y amigos, aprovechando la ventaja de que los productos que ofrece son muy reconocidos, por lo que se venden con facilidad. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de productos y mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, y ropa en general), así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer las necesidades y requerimientos de sus clientes, dando como resultado un incremento en el margen de ganancias que recibe, ya que los productos al ser comprados en cantidades, disminuyen el costo. De esta forma Ana desea seguir trabajando arduamente para que en un futuro cercano tenga la posibilidad de independizarse totalmente y cumplir su sueño de abrir un almacén de variedades, en un sector reconocido, en el que sus ventas incrementen y le generen una estabilidad económica para brindar a su hijo y a su esposo, mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana has been working in retail for twelve years, so she has vast experience and knowledge of her field. Some years ago, a neighbor taught her everything related to selling merchandise by catalog, which is how she got started in that business too in order to supplement the income she makes and uses to help her husband support their household. She offers the products to her current coworkers, neighbors, relatives, and friends, making the most of the advantage of selling very well known products that sell easily. 

She is currently requesting a loan in order to invest in purchasing wholesale products and merchandise (fragrances, body lotions, cosmetics, and clothing in general). This will allow her to stock up and meet her customers' needs and requests, which will result in an increased profit, because when the products are bought in bulk the cost decreases.

Ana wants to keep working hard so that she has the opportunity of becoming completely independent in the near future and of making her dream come true, which is to open her own store in a well known neighborhood, so that her sales increase and generate financial stability to give her son and her husband better living standards.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products and merchandise.

loans.name: Jazmin Poty Group

texts.es:
Las 21 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas son mujeres muy entusiastas que quieren salir adelante, es por eso que se están esforzando al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La señora Maria es integrante ella quiere invertir su préstamo en compra de telas, para la confección de ropas y sabanas, el cual es su trabajo y medio con el que ayuda a su familia.
Todas ellas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer e ir mejorando en el emprendimiento de cada una.
texts.en:
The 21 members of this group are involved in different businesses and each one is very enthusiastic and determined to get ahead.  That is why they work as hard as they can to help their families.

One of the members, Maria, wants to use the loan to buy fabrics to make clothing and sheets.  She works as a seamstress in order to help the family.

All of the members are grateful for the opportunity to expand and improve their respective businesses.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
San Expedito, está en su primer ciclo  dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas ellas se han comprometido a  trabajar y a realizar actividades  para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo. 
Integrante de este grupo, y alguien digno de destacar es la Sra. Blanca, quien tiene una peluquería donde trabaja arduamente día a día para dar a sus clientas un buen servicio. Ella lucha por mejorar y crecer siempre, para dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan y que no les falte nada.
Pide de este préstamo para poder surtirlo con todo tipo de insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The San Expedito Group is in its first loan cycle of the women's program where all of the members are committed to their work and carrying out activities to reach common goals.

An important member of the group is Blanca who has a beauty salon where she works hard, day after day, to giver her customers good service.  She constantly struggles to improve and grow so she can give her family all they need so they never lack for anything.

She is requesting a loan to stock her salon with shampoo, conditioner, hair color, and other supplies.  She is grateful for this opportunity so she can continue working.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, conditioner, hair color, etc.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en informática, y comenta que su meta es poder recibirse y poder trabajar en alguna entidad publica y sirva mejor al país.
Pidede este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de manutención y también para sus gastos de transporte. Es una persona muy estudiosa que se dedica mucho.
texts.en:
Pablo, from Carapeguá, is studying computer engineering at university.  He says his goal is to be hired and work in a state entity which will help his country.

He is asking for this loan to pay for his living costs and also for transport costs.  He studies very hard and is very dedicated.

loans.use: to pay for living and transport costs.

loans.name: Magdonio

texts.es:
Magdonio es un hombre muy trabajador, se dedica a la reparación de aparatos electrónicos y también de celulares, que lucha para poder seguir creciendo, y demostrar que la edad no es impedimento para poder luchar y seguir trabajando. Su crédito anterior lo utilizo para poder comprar artículos electrónicos y también para la actualización de programas para reparación de celulares.
Hoy pide de un nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de un soldador a aire electrónico y repuestos para artículos electrónicos.
texts.en:
Magdonio is a very hard worker and earns a living repairing electronic equipment and cellular products.  He struggles to continue growing and to demonstrate that age is no obstacle when it comes to working.

He used his previous loan to buy electronic equipment and to renovate some of his cellular repair programs.  

Now he is requesting a new loan to buy an electronic welder and spare parts for electronic products.

loans.use: To buy an electronic welder and spare parts for electronic products.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
cuenta que vive con sus padres quienes le dieron los valores suficientes para cumplir con sus responsabilidades. Anhela terminar su carrera  y ser un profesional autosuficiente para así poder servir con sus conocimientos a los demás. 
Está estudiando la carrera de Análisis de Sistemas, y quiere que conforme pase el tiempo pueda ir aumentando sus conocimientos por medio de otros cursos y capacitaciones. Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus gastos de titulación, que le permitirá poder recibirse dentro de poco tiempo.
texts.en:
Luis tells us that he lives with his parents, who have instilled in him the values of being a responsible person.  He wishes to finish his degree and be an independent person so that he can use his skills and knowledge to help others.

He is studying a degree in Systems Analysis, and he would like to improve his knowledge as time goes on with the help of other courses and training.  He is asking for this loan to pay for his education expenses, which will allow him to graduate soon.

loans.use: to pay for his studies.

loans.name: Rwere Tukore Group

texts.en:
Naume is a member of Rwere Tukore Group and a resident of Nyakiju Bugyera, Buyanja – Rukungiri District. She is engaged in goat trade as the main source of income for her and her family. She also has some cows, which supplement the goat income. She is a married woman who is 50 years old and has nine children. Naume would like this loan to buy more goats. She has plans to grow her farm and become a model farmer in her village.

She is grateful to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) and the Kiva program for the services rendered. The whole group of 6 clients is taking a total loan of UGX 2,300,000.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Jesus Misericordioso Group

texts.es:
Este grupo trabaja hace 10 ciclos juntas, ayudándose a mejorar ya que quieren dar a sus familias lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Ellas son mujeres emprendedoras que con sacrificio están creciendo y luchando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celsa, ella tiene una despensa en su casa y tiene una buena clientela formada. También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder progresar continuamente.
Celsa pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, panificados, verduras, lácteos y demás, y así seguir luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: This group has been working together for 10 loan cycles, helping each other to improve because they want to give their families what they themselves couldn't have.  They are enterprising women who, with sacrifices, are growing and striving.  One of the members is Celsa, who runs a store out of her house.  She has built a good clientele.  The advisors' work should also be pointed out.  They regularly monitor the trainings and checks which, in one way or another, require and at the same time incentivize the women to work hard so they can continually make progress.  Celsa requests this loan to buy supplies for her store, such as beverages, baked goods, vegetables, dairy products, etc., so she can continue striving to improve her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked good, vegetables, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana tiene 40 años, se dedica en la venta de ropas usadas y venta queso con su marido. Gracias al trabajo que están haciendo pueden mantenerse y ayudarse para crecer.
La señora Juana siempre demostró ser una persona responsable  con sus compromisos, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quesos y más ropas para la venta, que le permitirá seguir trabajando y mejorando su vida y a de su familia. Agradece por la  oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha utilidad.
texts.en: Juana, 40, sells used clothing and cheese along with her husband.  This work allows them to sustain themselves and helps them to grow.  Juana has always shown herself to be responsible about her commitments.  She requests the loan to buy cheese and more clothing to sell.  This will allow her to continue working and improving her life and the lives of her family members.  She is thankful for this opportunity which will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy cheese and clothing to sell

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as polite and focused. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a very productive area and his primary customers are local residents. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle. His business goal is to have a home within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be a successful businessman. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a 29-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as social. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for nine years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that during the rain season, the business is difficult to run. 

He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will advance to a higher level of business and transport. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM; his previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 33-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as focused, determined and honest. He operates a restaurant where he sells tea and cooked food. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low demand. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that he will have a brighter future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from six to twelve years. She describes herself to be focused and determined. She operates a tea farm where she grows tea to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be climatic changes. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 49-year-old married woman. She has two children, who are 20 and 25 years old. She describes herself as a serious business lady. She operates a shoe stall where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an appropriate area. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to add to her stock of shoes for resale. Her business goal is to open a shoe shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a big shoe shop.

loans.use: add to her stock of shoes for resale

loans.name: Bett

texts.en:
Bett is a 28-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as determined. 

Bett operates a tea farm where she grows tea for sale. Bett has been involved in the tea business for five years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be climatic changes. She also keeps dairy cattle to earn extra income.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children whose ages range from 10 to 16 years. She describes herself as honest and faithful. She operates a workshop where she sells furniture and has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are retailers and wholesalers. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of enough capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy timber and materials for making furniture. She hopes that in the future she will add stock, and her goal is to open another shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy timber and materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as determined and confident. She operates a retail store where she sells metallic boxes, jikos (stoves), etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as having no permanent place to do business. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add stock of metallic boxes and jikos. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that she will have a brighter and more successful future. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Ann's previous loan of 20,000 KES was successfully repaid.

loans.use: add stock of metallic boxes and jikos (stoves).

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 42-year-old married man with six children. He describes himself as committed. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an appropriate area and his primary customers are home builders. He states that his biggest business challenge is transportation. He will use the 45,000 KES loan to buy more stock of stones for resale. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stones for resale

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as focused, determined, and honest. He operates a grinding mill where he grinds maize to sell as maize flour. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an area of high potential. His primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low demand. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more maize. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his second loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children, ages two years and four years. He describes himself as hopeful. He operates a timber store where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be government restrictions. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more trees to produce timber. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that he will have a brighter future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more trees

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a 26-year-old married man. He has two children, ages two and five. He describes himself as honest. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the tendency of meat prices to go up. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more meat for resale. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more meat for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has six children, ranging in age from 12 to 26 years. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a tea farm where he sells tea leaves. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are on a small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be heavy rainfall, which affects tea production. He will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. His business goal is to excel within five years, and he hopes that he will have a brighter future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a married man with five children. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a retail store where he sells jiko stoves. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and he has all types of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy metal sheets and nails for making jiko stoves. His business goal is to have a big supermarket within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and nails for making jiko stoves.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Itá  Son 7 jóvenes que se unieron con el objetivo de poder empezar a trabajar y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias. Ellos están muy entusiasmados ya que podrán ayudar con los ingresos de la casa, y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles.
Uno de estos jóvenes es Hector, quien tiene 21 años, cuenta que está trabajando en un depósito, y a la vez  está queriendo emprender con la venta de productos para el hogar. Él es un joven de muy buena familia, todos son muy trabajadores, y quiere poder seguir el ejemplo que sus papas le dieron, y de esa forma poder ayudarles y que se sientan orgullosos de él. 
Pide de este crédito para la compra de artículos para el hogar, como aceite, jabón de lavar, detergentes, arroz, etc.  lo que le ayudará a poder seguir trabajando. En la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas ya que aparte de los jóvenes están los codeudores.
texts.en:
This group, from Itá, is made up of seven young adults who joined together with the aim of starting work to get along and be able to help their families.  They are very keen as they will be able to contribute to the household expenses, making them feel useful.

One of these members is Hector, 21, who works in a store and wants to set up his own business selling household products.  He comes from a very good, hard-working family, and he wants to follow his parents’ example and help them and make them feel proud of him.

He is asking for a loan to buy household goods such as oil, soap, detergent, rice, etc.  This will help him continue working.  In the photo there are more people because it includes the borrowers as well as their fellow members who are also co-signers.

loans.use: to buy household goods such as oil, soap, detergent, rice, etc.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La Sra. Herminia tiene 64 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos ya mayores, ella empezó trabajando desde muy joven como empleada de una fábrica, después de mucho sacrificio pudo comprar un vehículo y alquilar como transporte escolar, luego de unos años entrego como parte de pago y adquirió un colectivo de transporte que actualmente  también alquila y vive de la renta de su colectivo.
Gracias a este trabajo pudo construir su vivienda, mantenerse y  darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Herminia  es una persona muy dedicada, sacrificada, responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. Solicita este crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de cubiertas para su transporte y así seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.. Agradece por la  oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Herminia is 64 years old and has three grown-up children.  She began working in a factory when she was very young, and after a lot of sacrifice was able to buy a vehicle and rent it as a school bus.  After a few years she traded in her vehicle as a partial payment and acquired a bus, and now she lives on the income from renting out her bus.  Thanks to this job she was able to build her house, support herself, and provide her children with a good education.  Herminia is a very dedicated, demanding, responsible person who is honest in her commitments.  She requests this loan to buy tires for her vehicle so she can continue working as she has been.  She is thankful for this opportunity, which will be very helpful in allowing her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy tires for her vehicle

loans.name: Deicy Yakeline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Deicy, tiene 36 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  18 y 11 años que estudian en universidad  y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Deicy es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar ya que el gana muy poco se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal y Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día sobretodo en las mañanas, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante y más cuando su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Communal Bank ‘Amigas de Tosagua’ get together every 15 days.  This place is known as being a dynamic city.  Most of the population work in agriculture and the farming of livestock as it is an area which has a lot of vegetation.
