El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un repuesto, para su maquina de coser, además comprara algunos materiales necesarios en su taller de costura; también,  le ayudara a su esposo a comprar un taladro para su pequeño taller de carpintería.

De esta manera, podrá tener en buenas condiciones su maquina y así atenderá las necesidades de sus clientes, para tenerlos contentos con sus servicios.

Al tener en buenas condiciones su maquina,  Mercedes podrá realizar todos los trabajos que le encarguen y así sus ingresos no faltaran, para subsistir junto a su familia.

Mercedes, esta planificando ahorrar, para construir un muro de retención, ya que vive a la orilla de un río y este al desbordarse le puede inundar la casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 45 years old, is married and she is a mother of 4. Her highest level of education achieved is the 6th grade, and she learned to trade of seamstress 25 years ago, which has been her main source of income to provide for her family. She makes clothing for a lot of her neighbors, and she also makes repairs for their outfits. During her free time, she does housework, like laundry and similar activities needed in her home. When she needs to buy materials, she travels in bus for about 45 minutes, from her town to the city.
The loan that she is requesting is to buy a replacement part for her sewing machine, and to buy materials needed for her sewing shop. In addition, she will also help her husband buying a drill, as he works in carpentry.
In this way, she can improve her sewing machine and efficiently meet her customers’ needs, and satisfy them with her services. She will be able to comply with all the orders and there will not be a lack of income in her household.
Mercedes also plans to save money to build a dam wall, as she lives near a river and it is she lives on the banks of a river, risking that if it overflows it could flood the house.

loans.use: to buy a replacement for her sewing machine, and materials for her business, as well as a drill for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es: La señora Juana Isidra se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado desde hace 21 años es madre de cuatro hijas ninguna depende de ella, la señora trabaja de lunes a sabado desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde, se ha esforzado por sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios, hoy en dia la señora se esfuerza por trabajar en su negociio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, se presento a la oficina a solicitar un financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materia prima para hacer bollitos de leche, churros dulces y cajetas para aprovechar las ventas de la purisima, tambien comprara verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana has made a living selling fruits and vegetables in the market for 21 years. She has four children who are are all independent. She works from Monday through Saturday from five in the morning until two in the afternoon. She has worked hard to move her children forward in school. She now works in her business to improve her living conditions.

She came to the office to request a loan to invest in buying raw materials to make spongy bread rolls, sweet churros, and caramels to improve her sales. She will also buy vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy quintales of potatoes, boxes of tomatoes, bell peppers, garlic, pineapple, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition fee and purchase silver to produce beautiful jewelry to sell to his clients

loans.name: Oyunai

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunai is a 50-year-old widow, and lives with her two children in a Ger (traditional nomadic tent) in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her older daughter is a university student, and her younger daughter is a senior student at a local high school.

Oyunai has been running an agricultural business since 2000. Her daughters are very supportive of her and her business. She grows organic vegetables and fruits at her plot of land, and sells them at her rental booth at a local market. 

She is a hardworking and experienced woman with good reputation among the clients. She is now requesting loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase fruits and other inventories to sell at her booth.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and other inventories to sell at her rental booth.

loans.name: Martha Jacoba

texts.es: La señora Martha Jacoba tiene su negocio de venta de bisuterias y jugos en su casa de habitacion en el municipio del viejo desde hace 14 años, la señora tambien elabora piñatas y queques por encargos, la señora es casada, madre de tres hijos ninguno depende de ella, es una señora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante el sustento de su hogar, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, solicita el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su venta y obtener buenas ventas a finales del mes de noviembre ya que en ese municipio se celebra la entrada de la virgen como fiestas patronales y la lavada de la plata  el 6 de ciciembre una fecha que miles de feligreses marianos visitan la basilica de esta ciudad. su negocio lo inicio con aporte propio, hoy en dia tiene una pequeña venta y a la vez trabaja con los queques y piñatas.
texts.en:
Martha Jacoba has been selling costume jewelry and juices from her house in the town of Viejo for 14 years. She also makes pinatas and cakes to order. She is married and has three grown children. She strives to support her household, working Monday to Sunday from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. 

She has applied for a loan to buy inventory to make more sales at the end of November, when the town celebrates the feast day of the entrance of the Virgin. December 6 is the washing of the silver feast day, when thousands of pilgrims visit the city's basilica. She started her business with her own funds, and today she has a small sales area and also makes pinatas and cakes.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, tortillas, juices , sodas, and snacks.

loans.name: Odonhuu

texts.en: Mr.Odonhuu is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, or traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and stays home taking care of the family, and their two children attend local kindergarten. Odonhuu has been making wooden furniture with his partners in their workplace since 2011. He crafts the wooden parts of a ger, furniture and during the summer he builds wooden houses for clients. He is requesting loan for 1,800,000 MNT to buy a large amount of carefully-selected planks and other wooden pieces to meet an order on time. He is a hardworking and diligent person.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of carefully-selected planks and other pieces of wood to make an order on time.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 64 years old and married with six children. Antonia works very hard to provide for them.

Antonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Antonia has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, biscuits, candies, snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Minasmayo De Garavito Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MINASMAYO DE GARAVITO”; Este banco se ubica en el sector de Garavito, distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención, departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                            
La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es viuda, tiene 54 años y tiene 02 hijos ; La socia altera sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas,cuyes,entre otros, la socia cría a estos  animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar animales (gallinas) y alimento.
Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura ,crianza de animales y trabajadores de empresa pública.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Minasmayo de Garavito" communal bank. This bank is located in the Garavito sector, Santa Ana district, La Convención province, Cusco department.

One member, Antonia, is a 54-year-old widow with 2 children. She alternates her daily activities in a business raising animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and other animals. She raises these animals to later sell them to customers who request them. She has worked in this business for a long time and it's going well thanks to her business efforts. She also works in agriculture. She wants to continue this work in order to support her family.

Antonia is requesting a loan to buy animals (chickens) and food.

The other members work in agriculture, raising animals, and working in public businesses.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Antonia are grateful to those who help her in this dream this way and she promises to make her payments on time as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy animals (chickens) and food.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa de 33 años de edad, tiene segundo grado de educación, está separada del esposo de ella desde hace 5 años, tuvieron en común 3 hijas,  las cuales están estudiando aún y viven con ella, además viven sus padres con ella. 

Ella posee como negocio un cafetín,  donde vende en las tardes pupusas y tiene productos comestibles como pan, golosinas, dulces,  entre otras cosas que demanda la gante, ella tiene 7 años de tener el puesto y de dedicarse al comercio tiene 23 años.  Antes de dedicarse al comercio formal, ejercía el comercio informal vendiendo pescado fresco en el municipio de donde es originaria. El trabajo está cerca de la casa de ella recorre 120 metros,  los cuales los hace caminando. Pero cuando le toca ir a traer mercadería, viaja 24 kilómetros en bus, 3 veces a la semana, el horario de trabajo es de 8 horas al día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar insumos para mejorar el negocio y productos comestibles que le ayuden a mejorar las ventas, además de la realización de una de un pequeño kiosco, donde atenderá a los clientes ya que actualmente no lo tiene.  El préstamo la ayudara a tener más clientes y podrá satisfacer la demanda que tiene por los productos que vende. La necesidad a satisfacer será la de ampliar,  surtir y mejorar el negocio, que es con  el cual mantiene a su familia.

Sus sueños son lograr tener un negocio fuerte y suficiente que me pueda generar ingresos suficientes para darles a sus hijas una vida digna y a ayudar de mejor  manera a sus padres,  que ya están avanzados en edad. Para sus hijos su sueño es verlos graduados de algún estudio de universidad y verlos alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 33, has second level education. She has been separated from her husband for 5 years. They have 3 daughters, all of whom are still studying and living with her. In addition, Rosa's parents live with her. 

She has a snack stand, where in the afternoon she sells "pupusas" (traditional Salvadoran dish – thick, hand-made corn tortillas) and consumable products such as bread, sweets, candies, among other things that her clients request. She has had this position for 7 years and has been working in this business for 23. Before formally working in commerce, she worked informally selling fresh fish in the municipality where she is from. Her work is near her house, 120 meters which she walks. But when she has to bring merchandise, she travels 24 kilometers by bus, 3 times a week. She works 8 hours a day.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase supplies in order to improve her business and for the purchase of consumables which will help her to improve her sales as well as having a small kiosk, where she will tend to clients, since at the moment she doesn't have one. The loan will help her to have more clients and will allow her to meet the demand she has for her products. The needs to be met are the expansion, supply and improvement of the business which is how she supports her family.

Her dreams are to have a strong and sufficient business that can generate enough income to give her daughters a decent life and to help her parents, who are elderly. Her dreams for her children are to see them graduate from university and to reach their goals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in order to improve her business and for the purchase of consumables which will help her to improve her sales, as well as having a small kiosk where she will tend to clients, since at the moment she doesn't have one.

loans.name: Group 7 - Tân Việt 01

texts.en:
Ms. Hinh, 37, is married with two children: one school-aged child and one small child. Hinh and her husband work in agricultural production, with a monthly income of approximately VND 1,400,000. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1996. Her family is currently using a double-pit latrine, which is now degraded. 

With her portion of this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve their health and living conditions and provide safety for them, particularly at night and during rainstorms. In addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, it will be contributing to the environmental protection of the community. 

In the picture, Ms. Hinh is standing in the front row, first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Judith Elizabeth

texts.es:
Judith  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como telefonista en una universidad de la capital.
Casada con dos hijos en edad escolar.
Judith es una mujer muy  trabajadora y su mayor esfuerzo lo hace para  darles a  sus hijos todas las condiciones necesarias.
 Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en pagos de estudios de sus hijos ya que al culminar el  año escolar, tiene que saldar todo lo pendiente y así garantizar los gastos de la promociones de su dos pequeño.
texts.en:
Judith lives in the city of Managua and works as a telephone operator at the capital's university. She is married and has two children who are school-age.

Judith is a hard-working woman and her greatest motivator is providing her children with everything they need.

She is requesting this loan to make school payments for her children so they can complete the school year. She needs to pay off what she owes for the school year for her two children.

loans.use: to pay school expenses.

loans.name: Margarita Veronica

texts.es: La señora Margarita Veronica tiene su negocio en el mercado, ahi vende productos de plasticos, aluminio y madera, vende platos, vasos, canastas, cubiertos,  batellas, amahacas, etc, es madre de tres niños todos estan estudiando, se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante, es casada cuenta con apoyo de su esposo, la señora Veronica solicita financiamiento para aprovechar las ventas de diciembre , necesita comprar al por mayor productos alusivos a la temporada de la griteria, comenzo con su negocio con poca mercaderia ahora ella tiene bien surtido su negocio. le gusta salir adelante poco a poco ha venido creciendo con su negocio y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita Veronica runs a business at the market. There, she sells plastic, aluminum, and wood products that include plates, glasses, baskets, silverware, trays, hammocks, etc. She is the mother of 3 children who are all studying. She makes an effort to get them ahead. She is married and has the support of her husband. 

Veronica is requesting funding to take advantage of December sales. She needs to buy products at wholesale for the season of the Gritería celebration. She started her business with little merchandise, but now she has her business well stocked. She likes to get ahead. Little by little she has been growing her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy baskets, glasses, plates, trays, buckets, piggy banks, etc.

loans.name: Enhbat

texts.en:
Mr Enhbat is 39 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ger, in a traditional nomadic yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife helps her husband's business. His older child is a university student and his three younger children are local school students. 

Enhbat has been working as an assistant at a construction site since 2000. He graduated from a special training course in interior and exterior design construction in 2003. He started his business with a group of people as contractors in 2005. He is a very experienced and hardworking man who dreams about creating a construction company someday. He is now requesting loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase tools and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for his business

loans.name: Samy Oswaldo

texts.es:
El Joven  Samy es muy emprendedor se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos actividad que realiza desde hace  cuatro años,  siendo esta su fuente principal de ingresos.
Samy necesita el préstamo para la compra de mas cerditos  para engórdales y  revenderlos, espera que esta inversión le genere en un futuro los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Samy espera seguir creciendo en su negocio y que se convierta en uno de los más grandes de la zona.

Trojes, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Samy is a young entrepreneur who makes a living by raising and fattening pigs. He has done so for four years and it is his primary source of income.

Samy needs this loan to buy piglets to raise and then sell. He hopes this investment will bring the future income he needs to move his family forward.

Samy hopes to keep growing his business and turn it into one of the largest in the area.

Trojes, Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Pagma

texts.en:
Mrs.Pagma is 31 years old and lives with her parents and a daughter in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her father works at a local company as an escort. Her daughter studies at a local public school.

Pagma used to knit woolen and cashmere clothes at her client's request at home. She has lot of experience and regular clients over the years. She is starting to sell clothing at a rented booth at the local market. She has good taste when selecting clothes and now is requesting loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a variety of winter clothes to sell at her booth. She is a hardworking and diligent lady.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet has a live-in partner and is 36 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Juliet has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 4 years. Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carmilla

texts.en:
Carmilla has a live-in partner with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmilla is 33 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Carmilla has a business selling firewood in the Philippines. Carmilla requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Carmilla has been in this business for two years. Carmilla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Edna has been in this business for three years now.

Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luís Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta  cuarto grado de educación, está acompañado desde hace 5 años;  su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar,  tienen en común 1 hija de tres años.

Luis se dedica a la albañilería, desde hace 9 años. Aprendió el oficio de andar trabajando con personas que ya sabían hacerlo y decidió dedicarse a eso porque le gusto y también porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a la familia.  

También cultiva maíz y frijol, para llegar a su trabajo recorre 8.5 kilómetros y lo hace en bus o dependiendo de dónde le busquen para trabajar en la agricultura le ayuda a su señora. El horario de trabajo son  8 horas diarias.


El préstamo que esta solicitando,  es para comprar  materiales de construcción, cemento, arena, hierro, para reparar su casa.  El préstamo vendrá a mejorar  la calidad de vida de la familia, porque estarán en mejores condiciones.
  
Su sueño es tener su propia compañía constructora, para poder trabajar más y ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 24 years old, has a fourth grade level education. He has been in a common-law marriage for 5 years; his partner is a homemaker. They have one three-year-old daughter in common.

Luis has worked in construction for nine years. He learned this profession by working alongside people who already knew the work. He decided on this type of work because he enjoys it and also because he couldn't find another way to help his family.

He also grows corn and beans. To arrive at his job he travels 8.5 kilometers by bus or depending on where they're looking for him to do agricultural work, he helps his wife. His work schedule is 8 hours a day.

The loan he's requesting is to purchase construction materials, cement, sand and iron to repair his house. The loan will improve his family's quality of life because they will be in the best conditions possible.
  
His dream is to have his own construction company, to be able to work more and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, cement, sand and iron to repair his house.

loans.name: Kattia Marcela

texts.es:
Kattia es una mujer joven que siempre ha buscado la forma de contribuir con el presupuesto familiar, ya que tiene dos hijas estudiantes, y su esposo es trabajador independiente.
Quiere con este  crédito acondicionar un espacio , en terreno que tiene desocupado , donde ella ofrecerá a sus vecinos el servicio de corte de cabello,principalmente a niños y hombres.
Ella realiza en las mañanas las tareas de su casa  y toma las citas del día , para organizar el trabajo y atención a sus clientes.
Su meta es mejorar los ingresos , hacer algo que le gusta que le permita crecer como persona  y poder compartir y estar más tiempo con su familia. Y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus vecinos a precios accesibles para ellos.
texts.en:
Kattia is a young woman who is on the look-out for ways to contribute to the household budget. She has two daughters who study and a husband who works independently.

Kattia wants to use this loan to prepare a space on land that is not being used where she can offer her neighbors hair cutting services especially for men and children. In the mornings she does her house chores and in the afternoon she takes appointments to organize her work and attention to her customers.

Her goal is to increase her revenues doing something she likes to do. Also she wants to share and spend more time with her family. And to offer good service to her neighbors at prices that are affordable.

loans.use: to buy hair-cutting equipment, a chair and tools.

loans.name: Group 2 - Tân Việt 01

texts.en:
Ms. Thach, 58, works in the agricultural production with a monthly income of nearly VND 400,000. She is married and has a grown-up son. At the moment, her son is married and staying in a house next to her's. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1975. Her family currently does not have a latrine, and she has to use her son's latrine. 

With her portion of this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve their health and living conditions, and offer safety for them, particularly at night and during rainstorms. In addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, it will be contributing to the environment protection of the community. 

In the picture, Ms. Thach is standing in the front row, first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Imelda has been in this business for eight years. Imelda earns more income from retailing electronic mobile load.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Carlos Antonio vive en un municipio  que esta al oeste de la capital trabaja en una empresa como fontanero. Trabaja de lunes a viernes y los días sábado asiste a la universidad para prepararse  ya que su  meta es culminar su carrera universitaria.
Es por esta razón que Carlos está solicitando un crédito a kiva - ceprodel para realizar pagos de mensualidad que tiene pendiente y reservación de cupo para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Carlos Antonio lives in a municipality west of the capital. He works in a company as a plumber. He works Monday to Friday and on Saturdays he attends university as his goal is to have a university degree. 

Carlos is requesting a loan from Kiva-Ceprodel to pay the monthly school fees and to reserve admission for next year.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy livestock for his business.

loans.name: Federica

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Federica works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Federica is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Federica has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es: El señor Serapio tiene 44 años, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, vive en concubinato y  tiene 3 hijos de los cuales una es independiente. Tiene una casa propia ubicada en la zona de Valle Hermoso, su principal ingreso proviene del servicio de transporte de pasajeros donde trabaja de lunes a sábado durante todo el día. El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una muralla para su casa, ya que la suya está a punto de caerse y eso resulta peligroso para su familia por la inseguridad que existe en la zona.
texts.en: Serapio, 44, works hard and is responsible. He lives in a common-law marriage and has three children, one of whom is grown. He owns a house in Valle Hermoso, and his main  source of income is providing transport service all day from Monday to Saturday. He has applied for a loan to rebuild a wall in his house because it about to collapse, which would endanger his family given the lack of security in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to build a wall in his house.

loans.name: Junali

texts.en:
Junali works hard to support her family. Junali has a live-in partner and has a general store business in the Philippines. Junali has been in this business for 8 years now.

Junali requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, cereals, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

Junali would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lidia Celina

texts.es:
Lidia de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta 9 grado de educación, es madre soltera de una niña que aún no estudia vive con ella, en el mismo domicilio de la cliente también viven sus padres y un hermano de ella que se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella trabaja vendiendo pan,  dentro del mismo cantón donde vive, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 2 años .también tiene otra actividad económica,  la cual es un pequeño establecimiento que ha puesto en un centro escolar de venta de artículos escolares. Antes de dedicarse a eso trabajaba en una tienda. Pero decidió mejor poner su propio negocio.  Su horario de trabajo es de 7 horas al día y para llegar a su trabajo recorre 4 kilómetros en autobús.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar artículos escolares para la venta, como: cuadernos, lápices, bolígrafos, libros entre otros. El préstamo le ayudara a surtir el negocio y tener una mejor venta y lograra satisfacer la demanda que se tiene en época escolar. Ella  hará crecer sus negocio y tendrá mejores ingresos lo cual le ayudara a que su hija este en mejores condiciones

Su sueño para su negocio es convertirlo en una gran librería y tener de todo lo que necesitan los estudiantes y para su familia es ayudarles a cumplir sus metas y darles una vida digna, que su  hija estudie  y se supere. 

El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su negocio con la compra de más insumos,  las ganancia la utilizara para arreglar parte de su casa que se está deteriorando.
texts.en:
Lidia age 26, was in school until grade 9. She is a single mother with one daughter who is not yet in school and lives with her. Her parents and one brother, who is a farmer, lives with her.
She sells bread in her village. She has been doing this for two years. She also has a small store in a school centre where she sells school supplies. Before this, she worked in a store. She then decided it would be better to open her own store. She works seven hours per day and travels 4 km by bus to get to work.
This loan is for the purchase of school supplies for sale, such as: notebooks, pens, pencils, and books. This loan will help her to stock her business and have greater sales. She will be able to satisfy customer demand in the school season. She will expand her business and make a greater income, which will help her daughter to have better living conditions.
Her dream for her business is to make it into a great bookstore and to have everything that the students need. Her dream for her family is to help them reach their goals and to give them a dignified life. She wants her daughter to study and succeed.
This loan will help her to improve her business with the purchase of more supplies. She will use her earnings in order to repair part of her home that is deteriorating.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for sale, such as: note books, pens, pencils, and books.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es: Julio es un joven emprendedor de 24 años de edad, con visión, proyección y muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ha trabajado en el campo de manipulación de alimentos en diferentes restaurantes de grandes empresas, hoteles y clubes deportivos, por lo que surge la idea de iniciar su propio negocio, un restaurante en el que pueda ofrecer productos a base de queso fundido como pizzas, lasagnas, sándwiches, entre otros, para lo cual ya posee el local, pero requiere el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (horno a gas, silletería, nevera, utensilios de cocina), surtido al por mayor (quesos, pastas, pollo, carnes frías, salsas, entre otros) y pagar el primer mes de arriendo y la publicidad; esto le permitirá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, con el que desea salir adelante, pues su principal meta es que tan pronto como este negocio comience a dar los primeros frutos, se pondrá en la tarea de abrir una nueva sucursal ubicada en otro barrio, así podrá generar una rentabilidad y estabilidad financiera para seguir apoyando a su familia con la carga económica del hogar y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julio is a young 24-year-old entrepreneur. He has vision, goals, and a great desire to succeed. He has worked in the food industry in various big restaurants, hotels, and sports bars. From this, he got the idea of starting his own business, a restaurant where he could offer cheese-based products such as pizzas, lasagnas, and sandwiches. He has a storefront but needs a loan to invest in the purchase of movables (a gas oven, chairs, a freezer, and kitchen supplies), as well as wholesale ingredients (cheese, pasta, chicken, frozen meet, sauces, and other items), and to pay the first month's rent and publicity. This will allow him to start his business project. He hopes to succeed. His main goal is to, as soon as this business becomes profitable, open a new branch in another neighbourhood. This way, he will be able to be profitable and to have financial security in order to continue supporting his family with the household expenses and to benefit from a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more movables: a gas oven, chairs, freezer, kitchen utensils), and ingredients wholesale (cheeses, pasta, chicken, frozen meat, etc), and to pay the first month's rent and some publicity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old and married with one child. With her child still in school, Helen works very hard to provide for him.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, vinegar, fabric conditioners, etc. to resell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, vinegar, fabric conditioners, etc. 

Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, vinegar, fabric conditioners, etc. to resell in her general store.

loans.name: El Progreso Del Vallecito Group

texts.es: El grupo “EL PROGRESO DEL VALLECITO” esta  conformador por 06 socios y socias quienes se dedican a brindar servicios y al comercio. Luis tiene 25 años es soltero quien hace 03 años se dedica al servicios de mototaxista. Años trabajaba como ayudar de construcción. Su mayor deseo es tener una línea de servicios de  mototaxi. El préstamo lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Luis es el primera persona parada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: El Progreso del Vallecito Group has six members, who are service providers and merchants. Luis, 25, is single and has been driving a taxi for three years. He worked for years in construction, and his great dream is to have a taxi service line. He will use this loan to maintain his taxi. The group thanks Kiva lenders for the financing. Luis is the first person standing on the right side.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de perfumería y cosméticos, desde hace 2 años.
Doña María tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de perfumes, lociones, glases, lis tic, cremas, etc. productos para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual espere le ayude mucho a obtener suficientes ganancias.
Doña María espera surtir su negocio ya que este esté posee una gran demanda de y gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. Su sueño es en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
María is hardworking and responsible and lives with her family in southern Honduras. She has been selling perfumes and cosmetics for two years. María operates her business from her house. She needs a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, glosses, lipsticks, creams, and other products to keep working so that, hopefully, she will make enough money.

María expects to stock her business and meet the great demand that she hopes will increase her household's income and improve her family's life. Her near-term dream is to grow her business so that she can keep supporting her family and so that her children receive the education they need to have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – October  2013

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, glosses, lipsticks, creams, and more for her business.

loans.name: Manar's Group

texts.en:
Manar is 33 years old. She is a married Iraqi woman with one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Manar is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. She learned to sew at a young age and by now has 10 years of experience with making dresses for women and children and also making small fabric household items based on her customers’ needs. The small, income generating activity based in her home allows her to be flexible with the household duties as well as with the orders received from the clients. 

A major obstacle, however, is the fact that in her area power cuts are frequent and can last for many hours, with no regular patterns or predictability. This makes planning the work difficult, and also leaves her little time for the actual orders to be completed. To be able to better plan the work and deliver better quality services she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to afford the purchases she is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Genrry Dagoberto

texts.es:
Genrry es un joven de 22 años de edad, estudio educación media (bachillerato).  Está soltero vive aún con sus padres y sus hermanos, con los cuales colabora en el trabajo agrícola y todo lo que desempeñan como familia. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura y también a la ganadería, desde que era muy pequeño.  Su padre le ha enseñado esta labor y decidió dedicarse a esta labor ya que ha intentado buscar un trabajo formal y estable pero no lo ha conseguido. Genrry tiene otra actividad económica, además de la agricultura y es la de electricista es un trabajo temporal;  pero le genera un ingreso adicional cuando lo buscan para esa labor. Para llegar a su trabajo el cliente recorre 3 kilómetros y lo hace caminando el horario de trabajo es de 7 horas al día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes mansos para arar y surcar el terreno donde sembrara la temporada del cultivo agrícola. Ya que en este momento no tiene esa herramienta de trabajo, el préstamo mejorara su vida; ya que le será más fácil realizar el trabajo agrícola que es la fuente de alimentación de la familia.

Sus sueños, son seguir trabajando muy fuerte para alcanzar sus objetivos y quiere cumplir un sueño de estudiar una carrera universitaria y para su familia desea ayudarles a conseguir sus objetivos. Desea conseguir un trabajo estable que le ayude a superarse.
texts.en:
Genrry is a young man of 22 with a secondary level education. He is single and still living with his parents and siblings, with whom he collaborates on the agricultural work and everything they carry out as a family.

Genrry has worked in agriculture and ranching since he was very young. His father has taught him this work and he decided to do it since he has tried to find a formal, steady job but has not. In addition to agriculture, he has another source of work as an electrician. It is a seasonal job but it generates additional income for him when he is sought out for this work. To arrive at his job he travels 3 kilometers on foot and his work schedule is 7 hours a day.

The loan he's requesting is to buy a yoke of oxen to plow the land where he will plant during the growing season. Since he currently does not have this work tool, the loan will improve his life by making it easier for him to carry out his agricultural work that is the source of food for his family.

His dream is to continue working hard to meet his goals and to earn a university degree. He would like to find a steady job to help him excel. For his family his wish is to help them meet their goals.

loans.use: to buy a yoke of oxen to plow the land he will plant during the agricultural growing season.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Yeabu from the eastern area of Waterloo2 in Freetown. She is married with three children. She started her business for the daily survival of her family.
 
Yeabu has run a local food business since 2009, selling local foods within her community. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Yeabu says that the main challenge of her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Yeabu has requested a loan to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, cassava, and grain for her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change status of living. In the future, she plans to expand her local food business more. She thanks you.

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, cassava, and grain for her business.

loans.name: Hodo Mohamed

texts.en: Hodo Mohamed is 20 years old. She studies at Admas University College in the Faculty of Information Technology where she is a senior student. Her main problem is the lack of a laptop to prepare her assignments, practice IT programs, and write her thesis book. She cannot pay the money all at once, so she requested a loan for a laptop from Kaaba MFI. Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señora Elizabeth de 24 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus padres al norte de Colomi, se dedica a la producción agrícola y la venta de haba y papa, haciendo cultivar en terreno de sus padres, además cría ganado vacuno para poder cubrir sus gastos, actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno lechero para mejorar sus ingresos a futuro, hacer realidad su sueño de entregar leche para el desayuno escolar y a la vez ofrecerle a su hija mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Señora Elizabeth, age 24, is a single mother and lives with her parents in the north of Colomi. She is a farmer and sells beans and potato which she cultivates on her parents' land. She also raises cows to cover her costs. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a head of dairy cows in order to improve her income in the future. Her dream is to provide milk for school breakfasts and to give her daughter better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a head of dairy cows.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta perfumería y cosméticos, desde hace 7 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Doña María también distribuye su producto en lugares cercanos que recorre ofreciendo. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de cremas, lociones, perfumes, glases, etc. productos para seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña María espera mejorar su negocio aumentando la diversidad de sus productos, de tal manera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes y gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña María espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y a sus hijos.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
María is a very hard-working and responsible person. She lives with her family in a department in the south of Honduras. For 7 years she has been carrying out her business , which consists of selling perfumes and cosmetics. She runs her business out of a room in her house in the municipality where she lives. She also sells her products by travelling around in areas near to where she lives.

Maria needs the loan to buy creams, lotions, perfumes, vials, etc., which she uses to carry on with her work. She hopes to improve her business by increasing the diversity of her products, so that her sales increase. Her hope is that this will help her a lot, because currently she doesn't have enough products to be able to meet her customers' requests.

Thanks to the loan, she hopes to be able to improve her family's quality of life with the increase in household income. In the short term, she hopes to expand her business and thus to continue supporting her family and her children.





Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del 2013

loans.use: to buy cream, lotions, perfumes, vials, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Sandra es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y trabajos secretariales, desde hace 7 años.
Doña Sandra su negocio funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de tinta para la impresora, papal, carta, lociones, cremas, perfumes, etc. estos últimos productos son para su negocio de venta de cosméticos.
Doña Sandra con el préstamo espera mejorar su negocio ya este esté posee una gran demanda de tal manera que sus ventas aumenten de forma y gracias a esto espera poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Sandra su sueño es que en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Sandra is a hard working and responsible person. She lives with her family in a community in the southern part of Honduras. She sells cosmetics and does secretarial work; jobs she has been doing  for 7 years.

Sandra does her work out of her home. She needs this loan to purchase ink for her printer, paper, cards, lotions, creams, perfumes etc… The last items are for her cosmetic business.

With this loan Sandra hopes to improve her business as there is a big demand for sales to grow. Thanks to this she hopes to improve her family’s quality of life a little with the increase in household income.

Sandra’s short term goal is to grow her business, with this she can continue to support her family and her children will be able to go to school so that they can have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras—October 2013

loans.use: to purchase ink for her printer, paper, cards, lotions, creams, perfumes etc…for her business.

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es: La señora Bacilia es de la comunidad de Boquerón, vive junto a su hija pequeña en la localidad de Tiraque, se dedica a la repostería y la educación de adultos en un Centro de Capacitación en la misma localidad, ahora está solicitando un crédito para capital de negocio para abrir una repostería en su casa, actualmente ya cuenta con algunos equipos solo le faltaría algunas cosas del rubro, de esta forma incrementaria sus ingresos y mejoraria sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Bacilia is from the community Boquerón; she lives with her young daughter in a small town of Tiraque. She works as a baker, and she also works in a center for capacity building of the elderly, located in her hometown.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, to open a pastry shop in her home. She already has some equipment, but she just needs some tools for the business, and in this way, she will  be able to increase her income and her conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary equipment to open a pastry shop.

loans.name: Idalia Lizceth

texts.es:
La señora Idalia es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con sus hijos y esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  compra y venta  de cerdos desde hace más de 10 años. 
Doña Idalia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  cerdos, con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor  a sus clientes.
Doña Idalia espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando que sus padres e hijos ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos. 	



Choluteca, Honduras  –Noviembre     del   2013
texts.en:
Idalia is a responsible, hard-working and honest person. She lives with her children and her husband in the south of Honduras. Her business consists of buying and selling pigs, which she has done for 10 years.

Idalia needs the loan to buy pigs, and with it she hopes that the sales of her business will increase, as she has more products to offer. In this way, she hopes to respond better to her customers. She hopes to meet all her needs, and to improve her and her family's quality of life a little. She hopes that in a few years her business will continue to expand and that it will become one of the biggest and most well-known in the region, and that she can continue to support her parents and children as their income is very low.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business.

loans.name: Verónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Verónica de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta educación media, termino sus estudios de secretaria aunque actualmente no desempeña su carrera, está casada desde hace 13 años tienen en común 3hijos ; los cuales estudian y aún viven con ellos. El esposo, se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella posee una sala de belleza, que hace poco instalo en su casa; porque no tiene el dinero suficiente para instalarla en un local en el centro del municipio donde vive.  Tiene 1 año de haberlo puesto. Esta actividad la aprendió, porque asistió a un curso de cosmetología, donde le enseñaron a realizar la actividad, en el negocio se involucra una hermana de ella a la cual, emplea durante el tiempo que ella no está o sale a comprar mercadería.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar espray, Tintes, cremas, pinturas para uñas, etc. El préstamo mejora los ingresos de la cliente y podrá sanear algunas necesidades puntuales que tiene sus familia. Además, podrá satisfacer la demanda que tiene dentro del municipio, ya que ella es muy conocida por hacer bien su trabajo. 

Su sueño para su negocio es convertirlo en un lugar grande y poner sucursales, luchar por sacarlos adelante.  Para su familia su sueño es que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria y logren tener un trabajo que le asegure tener una vida digna.  Las ganancias de este préstamo las utilizara,  para poner el negocio en el centro del municipio.
texts.en:
Verónica is 34 years old and went as far as high school. She finished her secretarial studies, although currently she is not following her career. She has been married for 13 years, and they have three children who attend school and still live with them. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She has a beauty salon that she set up in in her home a short time ago, because she doesn't have enough money to set it up in a location in the center of the town where she lives. Her business has been operating for a year. She learned this livelihood because she attended a cosmetology course, where they taught her to do it. Her sister is involved in the business, and she employs her during the time she is not there or goes out to buy merchandise.

The loan she is requesting is to buy hairspray, tints, creams, nail polish, etc. The loan improves the borrowers income and she will be able to address some specific needs that the family has. In addition, she will be able to satisfy the demand she has in the town, as she is very well known for doing her work well. 

Her dream for her business is to make it into a large place,  to set up branches, and to strive to make them successful.  For her family, her dream is for her children to go to university and manage to have a job that will assure them of having a decent life. She will use the earnings that result from this loan to set up the shop in the center of town.

loans.use: To buy hairspray, tints, creams, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan es un joven agricultor de 25 años de edad, que durante toda su vida ha estado involucrado en las actividades del campo, pues nació en el seno de una familia campesina, gracias a ello, desde hace 8 años posee su propio cultivo de tomate de árbol con 600 palos en cosecha y 800 más con tres meses de sembrados, además cuenta con ganado de levante; la cosecha que recolecta es vendida en la plaza de mercado de la región y, de esta manera genera los recursos económicos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Su actitud emprendedora, su carisma y dinamismo lo han llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone y por ello se motiva a solicitar el crédito, con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas, fertilizantes, entre otros), con los que podrá seguir cuidando sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha mucho más productiva, así generará mejor nivel de utilidades y en un futuro poder cumplir el sueño de adquirir una finca propia en la que pueda tener sus cultivos y su ganado, generando una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Juan is a young 25 year old farmer who has been involved in field activities all his life.  He was born into a farming family and thanks to that he has had his own tomato crops for eight years; 600 trees being harvested and 800 more with three months of growth left.  He also has livestock.  He sells his harvest in the regional market plaza and generates enough income for the household finances.  His entrepreneurial attitude, charisma, and dynamic ways have allowed him to achieve his goals, so he is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies in quantity (compost, pesticides, fungicides, fertilizers, etc.) so he can continue caring for his crops and have a more productive harvest.  In this way he will generate greater income and be able to achieve his future dream of buying his own farm, where he can have his crops and livestock.  This way he will generate more income to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: El señor Salome A.B. es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia su mayor sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y dejar en sus hijos como herencia el amor al trabaja (agricultura) el credito lo solicita para comprar insumos y fertilizantes necesarios como: Insectisidas, Funjisida, Triple, Completo, todos estos para darle un optimo mantenimiento a su cosecha de Piña y Pitahaya, ya que el desea aprovechar las lluvias que han pasado para que le hagan un limpieza y luego darle mantenimiento, Agradece el apoyo que ha a recibido de Kiva y Afodenic en estos ultimos creditos.
texts.en:
Salome A.B. Is a hard-working man, dedicated to his family. His greatest dream is to improve their living conditions and to instill in his children as a legacy, the love for working in agriculture.

He is requesting the loan to buy necessary agricultural supplies and fertilizers such as: insecticides, fungicides, herbicides; all these to provide optimal maintenance to his pineapple and dragonfruit crop. This is because he wishes to take advantage of the rains that have occurred to do clearing and then do maintenance. 

He is grateful for the support he has received from Kiva and Afodenic in previous loans.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Doña  Amanda es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su familia en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de Rosquillas y cuajada el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña Amanda necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como leche, sal,  harina, soda, leña, etc. para seguir elaborando sus rosquillas y cuajada de esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar.
Doña Amanda espera gracias al  préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos. Ella espera que su negocio.  
Doña Amanda su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más reconocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre  del  2013
texts.en:
Amanda is a very hard working and responsible person; she lives with her family in a community located in the southern region of Honduras. She makes and sells “rosquillas” (corn flour pastries) and “cuajada”  (a milk curd/cheese product), which are well known foods in her community, and there is high demand for them.

Amanda hopes that thanks to this loan she will be able to obtain the supplies to continue with her business, and respond to the customers’ requests. She expects that the sales will increase, and this will reflect positively in her family's quality of life.

Her dream is that her business continues to increase, becoming the most popular in her city, so that she may continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, salt, flour, baking soda, wood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost, among others.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 32 years old and single. Juvelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Juvelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like candies, snack foods, bath soap, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

Juvelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, bath soap, detergent soap, noodles, etc. 

Juvelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like candies, snack foods, bath soap, detergent soap, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 37 and a mother of six children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She is a very hard working and honest person. Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers various types of delicious foods twice a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earns a good profit from the restaurant business. She helps her husband by cooking various foods at home for her husband to sell at his restaurant. He offers tea to his customers as well. Now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron etc. Due to their household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy the desired things.

Therefore, Shamim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron etc. She thanks Kiva and appreciates their warm support.

loans.use: To buy furniture, utensils, a cauldron, spices etc for the restaurant.

loans.name: Willian Rafael

texts.es:
Willian es un joven de 23 años de edad, lleno de energía  y ganas de salir adelante, en su infancia vivió momentos difíciles dado que solamente pudo estudiar hasta 6°  grado, pues sus padres tenían miedo de que la delincuencia lo atrapara en sus garras. Actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos, hace  2 años consiguió trabajo en la alcaldía, en el área de mantenimiento fue  así que decidió acompañarse, su pareja  con quien  tiene un bebe de 6 meses de nacido. 

Él tiene  2 años de trabaja en la alcaldía,  específicamente como ayudante de albañil, este trabajo  lo aprendió con su papá quien desde pequeño le enseño a él  y sus hermanos a trabajar para pudieran salir adelante.

El préstamo será utilizado, para la construcción de vivienda, los materiales que comprara serán: cemento, ladrillos, lamina, hierro, el trabajo de construir la vivienda lo realizara él  y sus hermanos ya que cuentan con la experiencia para hacerlo.

En el futuro piensa prepararse más en el trabajo de albañilería y así poder tomar trabajos independientes, que le permitan tener mayores ingresos parta salir adelante  con su familia.
texts.en:
William, 23, is full of energy and desire to get out ahead. As a child, he had some difficult times given that he was only able to study until 6th grade. His parents were afraid that he would get caught up in crime. Now he lives with his parents and siblings. He has been working in city hall for 2 years in maintenance. He has a partner and they have a 6-month-old baby.

He has been working in city hall for 2 years, namely as a builder’s assistant. He learned this work from his father who taught him and his brothers when they were young so that they could come out ahead.

The loan will be used to construct his house. The materials to be purchased are: cement, bricks, sheet metal and iron. He and his brothers will do the work as they have experience. 

In the future, William thinks of working in construction and so he can get independent jobs, which will allow him to receive higher income in order to have his family come out ahead.

loans.use: to construct his house. The materials to be purchased are: cement, bricks, sheet metal and iron.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a resident of Ruhindo, in the Rukungiri District. For the past nine years, he has been dealing in produce, mainly matooke (bananas). Herbert buys from farmers and sells to neighboring trading centers, markets, and the Rukungiri Municipality. He has a ready market for his matooke because he has customers that he supplies on a daily basis. 

Herbert is requesting a loan to buy more matooke to satisfy his customers who increase in number day by day. His dream for the future is to buy a vehicle which will make his transportation easier and save time to serve his customers better. Herbert will also get higher profits for his personal development. He appears in this photograph with the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 66 years old and is married with one child. For the past eight years, she has run a food-vending business in the Philippines. Lucia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucia is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 29 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Baybay Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosalyn runs a fish-selling business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for almost two years.

Rosalyn is requesting a loan to purchase additional materials to repair her house. In the future, she hopes to improve her livelihood to be able to provide more services for her clients and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her house

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old. She lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta City and works as a rice farmer. She and her husband do not make enough income from their rice field to sustain their family’s needs. Therefore, also Jocelyn sells rice to help her husband.  

Jocelyn is requesting a loan from PMPC to purchase bags of rice to sell. She hopes to expand her business and hopes to see all of her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 49 years old and lives in Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. She has a meat shop where she earns a meager income of PHP 10,000 per month. She has been doing this type of work for eight years now.

Amy is eyeing to expand her business. She has requested a loan to buy kilos of meat to sell. She thinks this can help her boost her income when she has enough inventories to sell.

Amy wants to maintain her membership with PMPC on a good record. She deeply wishes to pay her obligations in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy kilos of meat to sell

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en: Marionito owns and operates a farm to plant and harvest corn.  He earns a living by selling his corn in the local community. He has been in this business for six years and has earned enough for the family and to successfully repay his previous loan from GDMPC. He requests a new loan  to purchase organic pesticides  and  fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticides  and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has run her business for the past five years and earns well. Anabella also works selling groceries in her general store. She has successfully repaid her previous GDMPC loans. 

Anabella is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She plans to use the revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 38 years old and married with six children. For the past three years, she has run a general store and she also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF.

Lucia is requesting a 9,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks such as dried fish, milk, soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, laundry soap, and other items to sell. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, milk, soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, laundry soap, and other items

loans.name: Liecil

texts.en:
Liecil is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liecil is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Liecil has a general store business in the Philippines. Liecil requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Liecil has been in this business for five years. In the future, Liecil would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris operates a restaurant and sells food from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is price fluctuation. Damaris has received a previous loan that she used to buy ingredients for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Damaris is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Basti

texts.en:
Basti is 42. She is an honest and kind woman who has been working in the agriculture sphere for more than 12 years. She makes an income from animal husbandry, fattening livestock at home with the help of her family. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a teacher in a secondary school and earns a small salary. For this reason, Basti is the family's main breadwinner.

She has dreamed about repairing their house for a long time. However, they don't have enough money to do so. That is why Basti is taking a loan of 500 AZN to buy cement, wood and so forth. She is relying on your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair their house.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en: Jessa is from Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is a 35-year-old, happily married woman with three children. She buys and sells rice in the market. She has many costumers that pay a good amount for the rice. However, because the price of rice has increased, Jessa needs to have additional capital to meet the needs of her consumers. She would like a loan from Paglaum MPC to meet these needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo, se dispone a sembrar y necesita capital para invertir en la compra de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas, ya que son los insumos necesarios para preparar la tierra. 
Con el préstamo don Carmelo, invirtió un la compra de insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar maíz y frijoles, lo que le dio una cosecha abundante, granos de calidad, sus ventas aumentaron, su economía mejoro, por lo que ha podido cancelar las deudas, mejorar su vivienda y sobre todo ha seguido apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carmelo is preparing to plant, and needs working capital to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides, as these are the supplies needed to prepare the land.

With the previous loan, Carmelo purchased agricultural supplies needed to grow corn and beans, which gave him an abundant harvest and quality crops. His sales increased and his finances improved, so he has  been able to pay off some debts and improve his home. Above all, he has continued helping his children with their education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a member in good standing with PMPC. She makes it a point to pay her obligations to the cooperative on time. At the age of 49, she opened her rice retail business in Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City.  Through a meager income of 7,000 PHP per month, Mercy is able to support the needs of her family. 

As Mercy continues her two-year membership with PMPC, she applied for a loan to buy additional rice to sell. Mercy wishes to pay her obligations to the cooperative and save portions of her income to build a decent home.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Darikhan

texts.ru: Дарихан 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Сыновья находятся в России на заработках, а младшая дочь -школьница. У Дарихан - среднее образование, работает в качестве технички в сельской управе, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Дарихан занимается животноводством и садоводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 овец и яблоневый сад, который приносит хороший урожай. Супруг реализует яблоки за наличный расчет реализаторам на местном рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет 2,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дарихан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Дарихан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на достижение стабильного финансового состояния.
texts.en: Darikhan is 43 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. Her sons are now in Russia as migrant workers, and the youngest daughter attends secondary school. Darikhan has received secondary education. She works as a janitor at the village administrative office. As an additional source of income for her family, Darikhan raises livestock and gardens. She started this business 20 years ago by buying livestock for 3,000 KGS. Her husband helps her out on the farm. Thanks to Darikhan's hard work, her farm now includes eight sheep and an apple orchard producing a good harvest. Her monthly income is 2,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Darikhan has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance  institution for a loan to increase her livestock by buying a cow. Darikhan plans to invest the resulting income into a further headcount increase, and plans to grow her savings so as to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build an additional room on her home. She will buy: rebar, cement, bricks, sand, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Rodolfo Jose

texts.es:
Rodolfo de 28 años de edad, soltero, originario de Managua,  es la capital de Nicaragua.  Se caracteriza por ser un joven dinámico trabajador, con ganas de superación personal.  En la actualidad, sus sueños es poder hacer crecer su negocio en los tres primeros anos.

Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de medicina, de forma ambulante. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, tiene dos años de haber iniciado su negocio al cual le está dedicando cien por ciento su tiempo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra  y venta de medicamentos genéricos y éticos como jarabes, inyecciones pastillas, vitaminas, cremas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  En la foto podemos observa al joven la cajas de medicamente la cual distribuye Rodolfo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 28 years old, single, and from Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is a dynamic and hardworking youth, with a desire to excel. Currently, his dream is to grow his business in the first three years. 

Thanks to his desire to succeed, he earns a living by selling medicine as a street vendor. He works 12 hours a day. He started the business 2 years ago, and dedicates a hundred percent of his time to it. 

His plan is to invest the loan in the buying and selling of generic, ethical medicines, such as syrups, injections, pills, vitamins, creams, so that he might earn more money in the future. 

In the photo, we can see Rodolfo with boxes of the medicines that he distributes. Rodolfo is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they might have decent employment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy and sell medicines such as syrups, injections, pills, vitamins, creams.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is married and has run a sewing business for the last twelve years in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Ma. Linda is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as fabric, thread, and zippers for her business.

In the future, Ma. Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional material such as fabric, thread, and zippers for her business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 35-year-old married father of two children who has been working as a barber for sixteen years. He also owns a small bus which he runs for transportation services as an additional income business to improve  his family's standard of living and increase his income.

Mahmoud is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to perform necessary maintenance on the van (small bus) that he owns and runs for transportation services.

Mahmoud hopes to open a spare auto parts shop in the future to improve his socioeconomic situation.  He likes his current business because he has a lot of experience and it can be managed with a  small amount of capital.   However, he is currently working hard to develop a new career.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on the van he owns and runs for his transportation business.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem, 45, is married and the father of three children. He has been working in the construction business for twenty-five years. Kassem specializes in the cement business. He also works as a school bus driver to generate additional income for his family.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car. The car will ease his business's transportation needs. Kassem hopes to keep on developing his business and one day have a construction company that does all phases of construction.

loans.use: to buy a car for his business

loans.name: Fe Glenda

texts.en:
Fe Glenda is 38 years old and married. She lives at Barangay 7, Polao, Tangub City, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she has decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Pauglam MPC, Fe Glenda obtained the capital to purchase her own piglets and feed. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional feeds and pigs. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to more easily maintain sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
